intro: Astragalus tumbatsica, commonly known as the Tumbatsica milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Astragalus tumbatsica is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
